alert.note: Alert for Callahan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 11:05PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Callahan County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1104 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clyde, moving east along Interstate 20 at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Baird around 1115 PM CDT. Putnam around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Admiral and I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 297 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
